definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
to absorb/to draw (a lesson, insight etc)/to assimilate
to breathe in/to suck in/to inhale
to adhere to a surface/to absorb/to draw in/(fig.) to attract/(chemistry) adsorption
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers

sentences.english: How long must the iron-hearted monster feed on our life's blood?
sentences.chinese: 這鐵石心腸的怪物吸着我們的血液，還得吸多久呢？
他吸了一口氣，強自鎮定。

sentences.english: So I took a deep breath and worked on the last nail.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了口氣，去拔最後一根釘子。

sentences.english: Rinse the cucumber with cold water, and drain on paper towels.
sentences.chinese: 用冷水將黃瓜丁衝淨，用餐巾紙吸乾淨水分。

sentences.english: He had smoked for so many years that his teeth were permanently stained yellow.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了那麼多年煙，牙齒都被永久地薰黃了。

sentences.english: He took a breath to clear away the cobwebs of the night as the raven flapped away.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了口氣吹走昨夜的蜘蛛網，烏鴉隨之撲翅飛開。

sentences.english: Mrs. Bradley: I always have … one cigarette after a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喫完飯後吸一支。

sentences.english: Wuhan"is delighted for frain", the Shui Shang wedding, attract to come to genius and beauty absolutely myriad.
sentences.chinese: 武漢“喜谷”，水上婚禮，吸引來才子佳人萬萬千。

sentences.english: Under this condition, synthetic resin at room temperature measuring absorption deionized water rate.
sentences.chinese: 在此條件下合成的樹脂於室溫下測吸去離子水的倍率。

sentences.english: He began to breathe at last, but his voice was unsteady.
sentences.chinese: 他終於開始吸上一口氣，但他的聲音聽來顫顫微微的。

sentences.english: I took a deep breath, gazed up at the sky and turned to Izumi.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了一口氣，凝視了一下天空，然後轉向泉。

sentences.english: Don't worry about it, Chi, the other dorm suck, they can't play soccer.
sentences.chinese: 不要擔心，遲浩田，其他宿舍吸，他們不能踢足球。

sentences.english: They are pleased that they needn't inhale second hand smoke any more.
sentences.chinese: 他們很高興再也不會吸到二手菸了。

sentences.english: The two-day Cortez Commercial Fishing Festival draws thousands of visitors each year.
sentences.chinese: 爲期兩天的商業捕漁節每年吸引來數千名遊客。

sentences.english: Then the right side piston from the left-side movement, this time self-closing suction valve 5.
sentences.chinese: 接着活塞從右端向左端運動，此時吸氣閥5自動關閉。

sentences.english: I took a drag on the glowing cigarette and began coughing and sputter-ing from the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我就着發熱的捲菸吸了一口，被煙嗆着，咳嗽起來。

definition: sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
one breath/in one breath/at a stretch
to breathe in/to suck in/to inhale
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
